metadata.title: CVE-2012-6057 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The dissect_eigrp_metric_comm function in epan/dissectors/packet-eigrp.c inthe EIGRP dissector in Wireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.4 uses the wrong datatype for a certain offset value, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (integer overflow and infinite loop) via a malformedpacket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6057` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark3 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap3 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil3 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
